section_purpose: To provide a concise overview of the paper, including the problem statement, proposed solution, methodology, and main findings.
key_points: Combinatorial optimization (CO) problems are NP-hard and present significant computational challenges.
Existing large language model (LLM) based approaches for CO often neglect structural priors, leading to suboptimality and inefficiency.
STRCMP is a novel structure-aware LLM-based framework that integrates graph structural priors to improve solution quality and solving efficiency.
The framework combines a graph neural network (GNN) for structural embeddings with an LLM for generating solver-specific codes, using evolutionary refinement for optimization.
Extensive evaluations on Mixed Integer Linear Programming and Boolean Satisfiability problems demonstrate STRCMP's superiority over baseline methods in both optimality and efficiency.

algorithms: graph neural network (GNN) for extracting structural embeddings
evolutionary refinement process for optimizing generated algorithms
architectures: composite architecture with GNN for embeddings and LLM for code generation
datasets: Mixed Integer Linear Programming (MILP) and Boolean Satisfiability (SAT) problems using nine benchmark datasets

dependencies: general knowledge of combinatorial optimization problems
familiarity with large language models (LLMs) and graph neural networks (GNNs)
reproducibility_notes: framework design integrating GNN and LLM for structure-aware code generation
use of evolutionary refinement process for algorithm optimization
specification of datasets (MILP and SAT domains with nine benchmarks)
